DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of container in which the collected blood specimen is placed

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._A hollow cylinder, especially one for holding or conveying liquids; anything shaped like such a hollow cylinder, e.g. an organic structure having the shape or function of a tube such as channel within a plant or animal body (e.g. fallopian tube).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:A hollow cylinder, especially one for holding or conveying liquids; anything shaped like such a hollow cylinder, e.g. an organic structure having the shape or function of a tube such as channel within a plant or animal body (e.g. fallopian tube).

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

A hollow cylinder, especially one for holding or conveying liquids; anything shaped like such a hollow cylinder, e.g. an organic structure having the shape or function of a tube such as channel within a plant or animal body (e.g. fallopian tube).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to isolation of cellular RNA.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to isolation of cellular RNA.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to genomic DNA isolation.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to genomic DNA isolation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The acid form of edetate, a chelating agent with anti-hypercalcemic and anticoagulant properties. Edetic acid binds calcium and heavy metal ions, forming soluble stable complexes which are readily excreted by the kidneys. This results in a decrease in serum calcium levels. This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.: A hollow cylinder, especially one for holding or conveying liquids; anything shaped like such a hollow cylinder, e.g. an organic structure having the shape or function of a tube such as channel within a plant or animal body (e.g. fallopian tube).

Concepts.definition: The acid form of edetate, a chelating agent with anti-hypercalcemic and anticoagulant properties. Edetic acid binds calcium and heavy metal ions, forming soluble stable complexes which are readily excreted by the kidneys. This results in a decrease in serum calcium levels. This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.

A hollow cylinder, especially one for holding or conveying liquids; anything shaped like such a hollow cylinder, e.g. an organic structure having the shape or function of a tube such as channel within a plant or animal body (e.g. fallopian tube).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A proprietary kit for at-home collection and stabilization of a stool sample for isolation of microbial DNA from feces for quantitative gut microbiome profiling.

Concepts.definition: A proprietary kit for at-home collection and stabilization of a stool sample for isolation of microbial DNA from feces for quantitative gut microbiome profiling.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that contains sodium heparin as an anticoagulant. This tube is used for preparing heparinized plasma, whole blood, and bone marrow specimens. It is identified by a green closure.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that contains sodium heparin as an anticoagulant. This tube is used for preparing heparinized plasma, whole blood, and bone marrow specimens. It is identified by a green closure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A proprietary blood collection tube designed for venous blood collection, containing EDTA anticoagulant and a cell preservative. The EDTA absorbs calcium ions, which prevents the blood from clotting. The preservative preserves the morphology and cell surface antigen expression of the epithelial cells and leukocytes. This blood collection tube has been used for the preservation of circulating tumor cells and lymphocyte subsets.

Concepts.definition: A proprietary blood collection tube designed for venous blood collection, containing EDTA anticoagulant and a cell preservative. The EDTA absorbs calcium ions, which prevents the blood from clotting. The preservative preserves the morphology and cell surface antigen expression of the epithelial cells and leukocytes. This blood collection tube has been used for the preservation of circulating tumor cells and lymphocyte subsets.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube with a formaldehyde-free preservative which stabilizes nucleated blood cells, preventing the release of genomic DNA, and allowing isolation of high-quality cell-free DNA.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube with a formaldehyde-free preservative which stabilizes nucleated blood cells, preventing the release of genomic DNA, and allowing isolation of high-quality cell-free DNA.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
